name: Windigo
descr: The [Windigo](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0124) group has been operating since at least 2011, compromising thousands of Linux and Unix servers using the [Ebury](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0377) SSH backdoor to create a spam botnet. Despite law enforcement intervention against the creators, [Windigo](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0124) operators continued updating [Ebury](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0377) through 2019.(Citation: ESET Windigo Mar 2014)(Citation: CERN Windigo June 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
technique_table_data.descr: [Windigo](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0124) has used a Perl script for information gathering.(Citation: ESET ForSSHe December 2018)

technique_table_data.name: Data from Local System
technique_table_data.descr: [Windigo](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0124) has used a script to gather credentials in files left on disk by OpenSSH backdoors.(Citation: ESET ForSSHe December 2018)

technique_table_data.name: Drive-by Compromise
technique_table_data.descr: [Windigo](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0124) has distributed Windows malware via drive-by downloads.(Citation: ESET Windigo Mar 2014)

technique_table_data.name: File and Directory Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Windigo](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0124) has used a script to check for the presence of files created by OpenSSH backdoors.(Citation: ESET ForSSHe December 2018)

technique_table_data.name: Proxy
technique_table_data.descr: [Windigo](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0124) has delivered a generic Windows proxy Win32/Glubteta.M. [Windigo](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0124) has also used multiple reverse proxy chains as part of their C2 infrastructure.(Citation: ESET Windigo Mar 2014)

technique_table_data.name: Software Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Windigo](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0124) has used a script to detect installed software on targeted systems.(Citation: ESET ForSSHe December 2018)

technique_table_data.name: System Information Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Windigo](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0124) has used a script to detect which Linux distribution and version is currently installed on the system.(Citation: ESET ForSSHe December 2018)

techniques.name: Impair Defenses
techniques.sub_name: Disable or Modify Linux Audit System

ESET Windigo Mar 2014.description: Bilodeau, O., Bureau, M., Calvet, J., Dorais-Joncas, A., Léveillé, M., Vanheuverzwijn, B. (2014, March 18). Operation Windigo – the vivisection of a large Linux server‑side credential‑stealing malware campaign. Retrieved February 10, 2021.

CERN Windigo June 2019.description: CERN. (2019, June 4). 2019/06/04 Advisory: Windigo attacks. Retrieved February 10, 2021.

ESET ForSSHe December 2018.description: Dumont, R., M.Léveillé, M., Porcher, H. (2018, December 1). THE DARK SIDE OF THE FORSSHE A landscape of OpenSSH backdoors. Retrieved July 16, 2020.

ESET Ebury Oct 2017.description: Vachon, F. (2017, October 30). Windigo Still not Windigone: An Ebury Update . Retrieved February 10, 2021.
